meanings.definition: The insertion of a day, month, or year into the calendar.
meanings.sent1: The intercalation of an extra day in February is called a leap year.
meanings.sent2: The intercalation of holidays can make the calendar more festive.
meanings.sent3: During the intercalation of a surprise holiday, everyone was thrilled.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter was like the intercalation of joy in a dull day.
meanings.sent5: The intercalation of a birthday celebration made the day unforgettable.

meanings.definition: The act of inserting something between other things.
meanings.sent1: Careful intercalation of notes in a book helps in studying.
meanings.sent2: The intercalation of a bookmark in the pages kept her place.
meanings.sent3: His intercalation of a joke in the serious meeting lightened the mood.
meanings.sent4: The intercalation of a pause in her speech added emphasis to her words.
meanings.sent5: The intercalation of a flower between the pages was a pleasant surprise.

meanings.definition: The process of alternating layers of different materials.
meanings.sent1: The intercalation of chocolate and vanilla layers made the cake delicious.
meanings.sent2: In pottery, intercalation of colors creates beautiful patterns.
meanings.sent3: The intercalation of music and silence in the play created a unique atmosphere.
meanings.sent4: The intercalation of light and shadow on the canvas added depth to the painting.
meanings.sent5: The intercalation of warm and cool tones in the design made it visually appealing.
